slide.text: "Using Java we can code: issue a command to the computer to do something, such as print text on the screen."
"A command to print text on the screen will look like that for example:"
"Java commands are all in English, without spaces between the words and every word starts with a capital letter."
"This type of writing is called camelCase, because the shape of the words is similar to camel humps."
"The new text is written next to the command, in brackets and inside quotation marks."
"Every Java command ends with a semicolon."
"This is one of the commands the computer knows how to execute, like other more."
"The programmer uses this set of commands that the computer knows to execute in order to defines more complex actions for the computer to perform."

exercise.question: "Every Java command ends with a period."
